intro: Rhamnus polymorpha f. sylvatica, commonly known as the European buckthorn, is a shrub or small tree native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, oval-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are a food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
